00010 class MOC_Log {

00039     protected static $adapters = array();
00040 
00047     public static function registerAdapter($name, $options = array()) {
00048         // Resolve the adapter class
00049         $Adapter = self::resolveAdapter($name);
00050 
00051         // Get the actual class name of the adapter
00052         $className = get_class($Adapter);
00053 
00054         // Make sure we don't add duplicate adapters
00055         if (array_key_exists($className, self::$adapters)) {
00056             throw new MOC_Log_Exception(sprintf('An adapter with the class "%s" has already been registered', $className));
00057         }
00058 
00059         // Add to adapter stack
00060         self::$adapters[$className] = $Adapter;
00061     }
00062 
00068     public static function unregisterAdapter($name) {
00069         // Resolve the adapter class
00070         $className = self::resolveAdapter($name, false);
00071 
00072         // Check if the adapter is registered
00073         if (!array_key_exists($className, self::$adapters)) {
00074             return false;
00075         }
00076 
00077         // Remove the adapter
00078         self::$adapters[$className] = null;
00079         unset(self::$adapters[$className]);
00080 
00081         return true;
00082     }
00083 
00091     protected static function resolveAdapter($name, $resolveToObject = true) {
00092         // Check if property is a object and it's a valid one too
00093         if (is_object($name)) {
00094             $Adapter = $name;
00095         }
00096         // If no underscore is in the class name, try to prepend MOC_LOG_Adapter
00097         elseif (false === strstr($name, '_')) {
00098             $className = 'MOC_Log_Adapter_' . ucfirst($name);
00099         }
00100         // Let's asume the user knows what he/she is doing
00101         else {
00102             $className = $name;
00103         }
00104 
00105         // Validate data
00106         if (!isset($Adapter) && !class_exists($className)) {
00107             throw new MOC_Log_Exception(sprintf('Unable to find adapter class "%s"', $className));
00108         }
00109 
00110         // Check if we want
00111         if (!$resolveToObject) {
00112             if (isset($Adapter)) {
00113                 $className = get_class($Adapter);
00114             }
00115             return $className;
00116         }
00117 
00118         // Create adapter instance if none is set
00119         if (empty($Adapter)) {
00120             $Adapter = new $className();
00121         }
00122 
00123         // Make sure object implements our interface
00124         if (!($Adapter instanceof MOC_Log_Adapter_Interface)) {
00125             throw new MOC_Log_Exception(sprintf('Object "%s" must implement MOC_Log_Adapter_Interface', get_class($Instance)));
00126         }
00127 
00128         return $Adapter;
00129     }
00130 
00139     public static function add($severity, $message, $ext_key = null, $additional_info = null) {
00140         // Don't do anything if we arent in the right log level
00141         if (self::getLogLevel() < $severity) {
00142             return false;
00143         }
00144 
00145         // Validate log level
00146         self::validateLogLevel($severity);
00147 
00148         // Push to the adapters
00149         foreach (self::$adapters as $Adapter) {
00150             $Adapter->add($severity, $message, $ext_key, $additional_info);
00151         }
00152     }
00153 
00159     public static function setLogLevel($level) {
00160         self::validateLogLevel($level);
00161         self::$logLevel = $level;
00162     }
00163 
00172     public static function getLogLevel() {
00173         if (empty(self::$logLevel)) {
00174             // Check if we can use getopt (console)
00175             if (function_exists('getopt')) {
00176                 $opt = getopt('d::');
00177                 // Do we have a getopt parameter "d"
00178                 if (!empty($opt['d'])) {
00179                     $level = strtoupper(trim(trim($opt['d'], '=')));
00180                     $constant_name = sprintf('LOG_%s', $level);
00181 
00182                     if (!defined($constant_name)) {
00183                         throw new MOC_Log_Exception(sprintf('Invalid log level constant "%s"', $constant_name));
00184                     }
00185 
00186                     self::$logLevel = constant($constant_name);
00187                 }
00188             }
00189 
00190             // Always default to LOG_WARNING
00191             if (empty(self::$logLevel)) {
00192                 self::$logLevel = LOG_WARNING;
00193             }
00194         }
00195         return self::$logLevel;
00196     }
00197 
00203     protected static function validateLogLevel($level) {
00204         // Validate severity
00205         if (!is_numeric($level) || ($level < self::EMERG || $level > self::DEBUG)) {
00206             throw new MOC_Log_Exception(sprintf('Invalid severity value (%d). Must be integer and be between LOG_EMERG (%d) and LOG_DEBUG (%d).', $level, self::EMERG, self::DEBUG));
00207         }
00208     }
00209 
00217     public static function addException($severity, exception $Exception, $ext_key = null) {
00218         return self::add($severity, $Exception->getMessage(), $ext_key, $Exception->getTraceAsString());
00219     }
